sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Secretary of State Buildings in Cook County Act.

sections.heading: The Secretary of State is authorized to construct and equip not
sections.text:
more than three buildings in Cook County, Illinois, on sites to be selected
by him, said buildings to be used by the Secretary of State for the
administration of laws relating to motor vehicles. The care, custody and
control of such buildings are vested in the Secretary of State.

sections.heading: The sum of $3,500,000.00, or so much thereof as may be necessary,
sections.text:
is appropriated to the Secretary of State from the Road Fund for the
acquisition of land, cost of construction, cost of equipment, and including
plans and specifications, and all necessary charges incident to the
completion of the work. For the purpose of acquiring sites for said
buildings, the Secretary of State may, on behalf of the State of Illinois,
acquire public or private property by lease, purchase, or eminent domain.
Expenditures for the construction and equipping of any of said buildings
shall not be subject to the provisions of any law requiring that the State
be vested with absolute fee title to the premises, if such expenditures are
made in connection with and upon premises owned by another public entity.

sections.heading: Eminent domain. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, any power granted under this Act to acquire property by condemnation or eminent domain is subject to, and shall be exercised in accordance with, the Eminent Domain Act
sections.text: Eminent domain. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, any power granted under this Act to acquire property by condemnation or eminent domain is subject to, and shall be exercised in accordance with, the Eminent Domain Act.
